column4: I'm trying to set up SSH keys, and it seems to work half-way, it says "Passphrase for key "imported-openssh-key"", so its picking up the key but it seems it still wants a password, however it is now the passphrase for the key not the password for the account...how do I make it not require the passphrase ?
use 'ssh-add' to make ssh-agent remember your passphrase for the duration of your gnome session
huh? I don't have gnome. I'm setting up keys on my ubuntu server so I can auto-connect for svn etc
as I said, it seems to half work but I'm clearly missing something
then you have to setup ssh-agent to cover your bash session
or generate an unprotected ssh key without a passphrase (but that's not recommended)
I'm following this tutorial; http://tortoisesvn.net/ssh_howto
do you have Windows on the client side?
yes, the mac should be much easier, I've gone thrugh the putty steps
I get the feeling that its not _quite_ doing the keys right on the server side
can you describe the actual problem again?
when I connect it should not require a password, instead it now requires the passphrase for the private key. I can log in via putty but it should be automatic
if you don't want it to require a passphrase to unlock your key, you have to set up a key without a passphrase.
or you need ssh-agent to manage the key for you, but this applies to Linux clients.#

only if your ssh key is unlocked
